#summary Below is a quick guide on setting up Zamf for use with CakePHP.

== Download ==

First, you will need to download a copy of Zamf or alternatively check-out the latest source using a subversion client such as Tortoise SVN.

== Setup ==

Once the files are downloaded, place the *zend* folder and all of its contents into the */cake/app/plugins/* directory.

== Configuration ==

Before using the Zamf plugin you must first make a few necessary changes:

  * */cake/app/webroot/index.php*
  Locate the line which says: _$Dispatcher = new Dispatcher();_
 Directly above it add: _App::import('Vendor', 'Zend.AmfDispatcher');_
{{{
if (isset($_GET['url']) && $_GET['url'] === 'favicon.ico') {
    return;
} else {
    App::import('Vendor', 'Zend.AmfDispatcher');
    $Dispatcher = new Dispatcher();
    $Dispatcher->dispatch($url);
}
}}}
 * */cake/app/app_controller.php*
 Now add the component to your _AppController_.
{{{
<?php
class AppController extends Controller
{
    public $components = array('Zend.Amf');
}
?>
}}}
